metadata.title: CVE-2012-3384 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in the customizer inWordPress before 3.4.1 allows remote attackers to hijack the authenticationof unspecified victims via unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-3384` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 3.4.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 3.4.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfifteen - 3.4.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfourteen - 3.4.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentythirteen - 3.4.1+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.1+dfsg-1').
